page.title: 11Tavistock Goosie Fair
page.content: Goosie Fair is a special occasion for Tavistock and all school children have a holiday so that they can enjoy the{Fun Fair and stalls.} In 1105 the Abbot of Tavistock was given a{charter}by Henry I to hold markets in the town. There was always a special market in the Autumn when farmers sold geese to the townspeople to celebrate Michaelmas or to fatten up for Christmas. The fair became known as Goosie Fair and is now held on the{second Wednesday in October.} * * * * * * * * * * * Nowadays, there is a special cattle market where geese are always for sale but stalls in the streets sell all sorts of things. The{Fun Fair,}lasting two weeks, has a Helter Skelter,Big Wheel,Dodgems,Ben Hur and other amusements. Thousands of people crowd into the town to enjoy themselves.
